section.name: Backlog
section.entry: バックログを開く (HOME ボタンで切り替える)
まだ実行中のすべてのスクリプトバックグラウンドプロセスを停止します。

section.name: Cube Shadowmap res:
section.entry: Choose a shadow quality preset for cube shadow maps (pointlights, area lights)... This specifies the maximum shadow resolution for these light types, but that can dynamically change unless they are set to a fixed resolution individually.

section.name: EyeAdaption:
section.entry: Enable eye adaption for the overall screen luminance

section.name: Shadow type:
section.entry: Choose between shadowmaps and ray traced shadows. Note that ray traced shadows need hardware raytracing support, otherwise they are not available

section.name: Display Output:
section.entry: Choose between different display output formats. If the display doesn't support the selected format, it will switch back to a reasonable default. HDR formats will be only selectable when the current display supports HDR output

section.name: VXGI Reflections:
section.entry: Toggle specular reflections computation for VXGI.

section.name: Key:
section.entry: Set the key value for eye adaption.

section.name: Sample count:
section.entry: The path tracing will perform this many samples per pixel.

section.name: VXGI Distance:
section.entry: Adjust max raymarching distance for VXGI.

section.name: Rate:
section.entry: Set the eye adaption rate (speed of adjustment)

section.name: Sample Count:
section.entry: Set AO ray count. Only for SSAO

section.name: Cartoon Outline:
section.entry: Toggle the cartoon outline effect. Only those materials will be outlined that have Cartoon Outline enabled.

section.name: Cutoff:
section.entry: Set maximum roughness which can be used to apply screen space or raytraced reflections.

section.name: Transparent Shadows:
section.entry: Enables color tinted shadows and refraction caustics effects for transparent objects and water.

section.name: DDGI RayCount:
section.entry: Adjust the ray count per DDGI probe.

section.name: 2.5D Light Culling:
section.entry: Enable a more aggressive light culling approach which can result in slower culling but faster rendering (Tiled renderer only)

section.name: 2D Shadowmap res:
section.entry: Choose a shadow quality preset for 2D shadow maps (spotlights, directional lights)... This specifies the maximum shadow resolution for these light types, but that can dynamically change unless they are set to a fixed resolution individually.

section.name: DDGI Smoothen:
section.entry: Adjust the amount of smooth backface test.

section.name: RT Reflections:
section.entry: Enable Ray Traced Reflections. Only if GPU supports raytracing.

section.name: AO:
section.entry: Choose Ambient Occlusion type. RTAO is only available if hardware supports ray tracing

section.name: Power:
section.entry: Set SSAO Power. Higher values produce darker, more pronounced effect

section.name: Visibility Compute Shading:
section.entry: Visibility Compute Shading (experimental) This will shade the scene in compute shaders instead of pixel shaders This has a higher initial performance cost, but it will be faster in high polygon scenes. It is not compatible with MSAA and tessellation.

section.name: Render Path:
section.entry: Choose a render path... Path tracing will use fallback raytracing with non-raytracing GPU, which will be slow. Changing render path will reset some graphics settings!

section.name: Raytrace Bounces:
section.entry: How many light bounces to compute when doing these ray tracing effects: - Path tracing - Lightmap baking

section.name: DEBUGJitter:
section.entry: Disable blending of frame history. Camera Subpixel jitter will be visible.

section.name: Threshold:
section.entry: Outline edge detection threshold. Increase if not enough otlines are detected, decrease if too many outlines are detected.

section.name: FSR 2.1 Preset:
section.entry: Set resolution scaling quality mode for FSR 2.1: Quality: 1.5x Balanced: 1.7x Performance: 2.0x Ultra performance: 3.0x

section.name: DepthOfField:
section.entry: Enable Depth of field effect. Requires additional camera setup: focal length and aperture size.

section.name: Dithering:
section.entry: Toggle the full screen dithering effect. This helps to reduce color banding.

section.name: VXGI Ray Step:
section.entry: Adjust the precision of ray marching for [reflection] cone tracing step. Lower values = more precision but slower performance.

section.name: GI Boost:
section.entry: Adjust the strength of GI. Note that values other than 1.0 will cause mismatch with path tracing reference!

section.name: DEBUG:
section.entry: Toggle visualization of the screen space light culling heatmap grid (Tiled renderer only)

section.name: Tessellation:
section.entry: Enable tessellation feature. You also need to specify a tessellation factor for individual objects.

section.name: Surfel GI:
section.entry: Surfel GI is a raytraced diffuse GI using raytracing and surface cache.

section.name: FSR 1.0:
section.entry: FidelityFX FSR Upscaling version 1.0. Use this alongside Temporal AA or MSAA when the resolution scaling is lowered.

section.name: FSR 2.1:
section.entry: FidelityFX FSR Upscaling, version 2.1. You can use this as a replacement for Temporal AA while also upscaling from lowered rendering resolution.

section.name: SSR:
section.entry: Enable Screen Space Reflections. This can not reflect anything that is outside of the screen.

section.name: VXGI Voxel Size:
section.entry: Adjust the voxel size for VXGI calculations.

section.name: LensFlare:
section.entry: Toggle visibility of light source flares. Additional setup needed per light for a lensflare to be visible.

section.name: Samples:
section.entry: Sample count of contact shadows. Higher values are better quality but slower.

section.name: Sharpen Filter:
section.entry: Toggle sharpening post process of the final image.

section.name: RT Diffuse:
section.entry: Enable Ray Traced Diffuse. Only if GPU supports raytracing. This effect computes single bounce diffuse with ray tracing per pixel. If DDGI is enabled, it will make it multi bounce.

section.name: DDGI Blend Speed:
section.entry: Adjust the contribution of newly traced rays. Higher values will make the DDGI update faster, but can result in increased flickering.

section.name: Color Grading:
section.entry: Enable color grading of the final render. An additional lookup texture must be set in the Weather!

section.name: VRS Classification:
section.entry: Enable classification of variable rate shading on the screen. Less important parts will be shaded with lesser resolution. Requires Tier2 support for variable shading rate

section.name: Temporal AA:
section.entry: Toggle Temporal Anti Aliasing. It is a supersampling techique which is performed across multiple frames.

section.name: FXAA:
section.entry: Fast Approximate Anti Aliasing. A fast antialiasing method, but can be a bit too blurry.

section.name: LightShafts:
section.entry: Enable light shaft for directional light sources.

section.name: Chromatic Aberration:
section.entry: Toggle the full screen chromatic aberration effect. This simulates lens distortion at screen edges.

section.name: Bloom:
section.entry: Enable bloom. The effect adds color bleeding to the brightest parts of the scene.

section.name: VXGI Full Resolution:
section.entry: Toggle resolve mode for VXGI opaque. Full resolution will use the full rendering resolution, otherwise it will be upsampled from lower resolution.

section.name: Texture Quality:
section.entry: Choose a texture sampling method for material textures.

section.name: Screen Shadows:
section.entry: Enable screen space contact shadows. This can add small shadows details to shadow maps in screen space.

section.name: Sharpness:
section.entry: The sharpening amount to apply for FSR 2.1 upscaling.

section.name: Occlusion Culling:
section.entry: Toggle occlusion culling. This can boost framerate if many objects are occluded in the scene.

section.name: MipLOD Bias:
section.entry: Bias the rendered mip map level of the material textures.

section.name: MotionBlur:
section.entry: Enable motion blur for camera movement and animated meshes.

section.name: DDGI:
section.entry: Toggle Dynamic Diffuse Global Illumination (DDGI). Note that DDGI probes that were loaded with the scene will still be active if this is turned off, but they won't be updated.

section.name:  Create Localization Template
section.entry:  ローカリゼーションテンプレートの作成
エディターのローカリゼーションの編集に使用できるファイルを生成する. テンプレートは現在選択されている言語から作成されます.

section.name: Name visualizer:
section.entry: Visualize the entity names in the scene

section.name: Bone Picker Opacity:
section.entry: You can control the transparency of the bone selector tool

section.name: Env probe visualizer:
section.entry: Toggle visualization of environment probes as reflective spheres

section.name: Theme:
section.entry: 配色テーマを選択する...

section.name: Info:
section.entry: Toggle advanced data in the info display text in top left corner.

section.name: Language:
section.entry: 言語を選択. XML ファイルを言語フォルダーに追加して、新しい言語オプションを作成することもできます。. 言語テンプレートを作成するために使用できるボタンが下にあります.

section.name: Freeze culling camera:
section.entry: Freeze culling camera update. Scene culling will not be updated with the view

section.name: Render Wireframe:
section.entry: Visualize the scene as a wireframe

section.name: FPS:
section.entry: Toggle the FPS display text in top left corner.

section.name: Disable albedo maps:
section.entry: Disables albedo maps on objects for easier lighting debugging

section.name: Save Mode:
section.entry: Choose whether to embed resources (textures, sounds...) in the scene file when saving, or keep them as separate files. The Dump to header () option will use embedding and create a C++ header file with byte data of the scene to be used with wi::Archive serialization.

section.name: Force diffuse lighting:
section.entry: Sets every surface fully diffuse, with zero specularity

section.name: Grid helper:
section.entry: Toggle showing of unit visualizer grid in the world origin

section.name: Collider visualizer:
section.entry: Toggle visualization of colliders in the scene

section.name: Transform Tool Opacity:
section.entry: You can control the transparency of the object placement tool

section.name: Version:
section.entry: Toggle the engine version display text in top left corner.

section.name: Camera visualizer:
section.entry: Toggle visualization of camera proxies in the scene

section.name: RT BVH visualizer:
section.entry: Visualize scene BVH if raytracing is enabled (only for software raytracing currently)

section.name: widget_2
section.entry: 大文字と小文字を区別する名前のフィルター処理を切り替える

section.name: New:
section.entry: 新しいエンティティの作成

section.name: Smoothness:
section.entry: Set the brush smoothness. 0 = hard, increase for more smoothness

section.name: Spacing:
section.entry: Brush spacing means how much brush movement (in pixels) starts a new stroke. 0 = new stroke every frame, 100 = every 100 pixel movement since last stroke will start a new stroke.

section.name: Backfaces:
section.entry: Set whether to paint on backfaces of geometry or not

section.name: Power:
section.entry: Set the brush power amount. 0 = minimum affection, 1 = maximum affection

section.name: Brush Shape:
section.entry: Choose shape for brush masking effect

section.name: Brush Radius:
section.entry: Set the brush radius in pixel units

section.name: Stabilizer:
section.entry: The stabilizer generates a small delay between user input and painting, which will be used to compute a smoother paint stroke..

section.name: Axis Lock:
section.entry: You can lock modification to an axis here.

section.name: Pressure:
section.entry: Set whether to use pressure sensitivity (for example pen tablet)

section.name: Wireframe:
section.entry: Set whether to draw wireframe on top of geometry or not

section.name: Rotation:
section.entry: Brush rotation randomness. This will affect the splat mode brush texture.

section.name: widget_11
section.entry: Open an image to use as reveal mode texture. Reveal mode means that the texture will use the UV of the mesh. It will be multiplied by brush tex.

section.name: Texture Slot:
section.entry: Choose texture slot of the selected material to paint (texture paint mode only)

section.name: widget_10
section.entry: Open an image to use as brush texture (splatting mode). Splat mode means that the texture will be relative to the brush position

section.name: widget_0
section.entry: タイプ別のエンティティにフィルタリングを適用する

section.name: widget_1
section.entry: 名前によるエンティティへのフィルタリングの適用

section.name: Far Plane:
section.entry: Controls the camera's far clip plane, geometry farther than this will be clipped.

section.name: Aperture Shape Y:
section.entry: Controls the depth of field effect's bokeh shape

section.name: Aperture Size:
section.entry: Controls the depth of field effect's strength

section.name: Aperture Shape X:
section.entry: Controls the depth of field effect's bokeh shape

section.name: Focal Length:
section.entry: Controls the depth of field effect's focus distance

section.name: Place Proxy
section.entry: Copy the current camera and place a proxy of it in the world.

section.name: FOV:
section.entry: Controls the camera's top-down field of view (in degrees)

section.name: Near Plane:
section.entry: Controls the camera's near clip plane, geometry closer than this will be clipped.

section.name: Cinema
section.entry: シネマモードに入ります(すべてのHUDが無効になります)。Esc キーを押して通常に戻ります。
動く (Ctrl + T) ホットキー: 1

section.name: Save
section.entry: 現在のシーンを新しいファイルに保存します(Ctrl + Shift + S) デフォルトでは、シーンは.wiscene に保存されますが、.gltf または.glb 拡張子を指定して GLTF にエクスポートできます。 Ctrl + Sを使用して、参照せずにすばやく保存することもできます。

section.name: widget_39
section.entry: Control the inward amount for large clouds (type 1.0). Specify amount top (X), top offset (Y), amount bot (Z), bot offset (W)

section.name: Load Color Grading LUT
section.entry: Load a color grading lookup texture. It must be a 256x16 RGBA image! You should use a lossless format for this such as PNG

section.name: WeatherPreset - Default
section.entry: Apply this weather preset to the world.

section.name: Type amount 1:
section.entry: Adjust the type amount from the weather map

section.name: widget_30
section.entry: Control the inward amount for small clouds (type 0.0). Specify amount top (X), top offset (Y), amount bot (Z), bot offset (W)

section.name: Tolerance:
section.entry: Big waves can introduce glitches on screen borders, this can fix that but surface detail will decrease.

section.name: Sky Receive Shadow:
section.entry: Realistic sky to recieve shadow from objects with shadow maps.

section.name: widget_20
section.entry: Control with a gradient where medium clouds should appear, based on type 0.5

section.name: Load Volumetric Clouds Weather Map 1
section.entry: Load a weather map for volumetric clouds. Red channel is coverage, green is type and blue is water density (rain).

section.name: widget_37
section.entry: Control the inward amount for large clouds (type 1.0). Specify amount top (X), top offset (Y), amount bot (Z), bot offset (W)

section.name: Type minimum 1:
section.entry: Adjust the minimum type from the weather map

section.name: widget_38
section.entry: Control the inward amount for large clouds (type 1.0). Specify amount top (X), top offset (Y), amount bot (Z), bot offset (W)

section.name: Realistic sky:
section.entry: Physically based sky rendering model. Note that realistic sky requires a sun (directional light) to be visible.

section.name: WeatherPreset - Night
section.entry: Apply this weather preset to the world.

section.name: Sky Texture Rotation:
section.entry: Rotate the sky texture horizontally. (If using a sky texture)

section.name: widget_28
section.entry: Control the inward amount for small clouds (type 0.0). Specify amount top (X), top offset (Y), amount bot (Z), bot offset (W)

section.name: Cast Shadow:
section.entry: Compute shadows for volumetric clouds that will be used for geometry and lighting.

section.name: widget_21
section.entry: Control with a gradient where medium clouds should appear, based on type 0.5

section.name: widget_36
section.entry: Control the inward amount for large clouds (type 1.0). Specify amount top (X), top offset (Y), amount bot (Z), bot offset (W)

section.name: WeatherPreset - Sunset
section.entry: Apply this weather preset to the world.

section.name: Curl height 1:
section.entry: Higher values pulls the curl more towards bottom

section.name: Coverage minimum 1:
section.entry: Adjust the minimum amount from the weather map

section.name: widget_29
section.entry: Control the inward amount for small clouds (type 0.0). Specify amount top (X), top offset (Y), amount bot (Z), bot offset (W)

section.name: WeatherPreset - Cloudy
section.entry: Apply this weather preset to the world.

section.name: Aerial Perspective:
section.entry: Additional calculations for realistic sky to enable atmospheric effects for objects and other drawn effects.

section.name: Weather scale 1:
section.entry: Scales the weather map that controls coverage, type and rain

section.name: widget_22
section.entry: Control with a gradient where medium clouds should appear, based on type 0.5

section.name: widget_35
section.entry: Control the inward amount for medium clouds (type 0.5). Specify amount top (X), top offset (Y), amount bot (Z), bot offset (W)

section.name: Cloud start height:
section.entry: This tells how many meters above the surface the cloud system should appear

section.name: Volumetric Clouds:
section.entry: Enable volumetric cloud rendering, which is separate from the simple cloud parameters.

section.name: Override fog color:
section.entry: If enabled, the fog color will be always taken from Horizon Color, even if the sky is realistic

section.name: Stars:
section.entry: Amount of stars in the night sky (0 to disable). It will only work with the realistic sky enabled. They will be more visible at night time.

section.name: Skew noise 1:
section.entry: Adjust the skew on noise alone

section.name: Cloud Receive Shadow:
section.entry: Clouds to recieve shadow from objects with shadow maps.

section.name: widget_23
section.entry: Control with a gradient where medium clouds should appear, based on type 0.5

section.name: widget_34
section.entry: Control the inward amount for medium clouds (type 0.5). Specify amount top (X), top offset (Y), amount bot (Z), bot offset (W)

section.name: Surface Detail:
section.entry: Adjust surface tessellation resolution. High values can decrease performance.

section.name: Color picker mode:
section.entry: Choose the destination data of the color picker.

section.name: widget_24
section.entry: Control with a gradient where large clouds should appear, based on type 1.0

section.name: widget_17
section.entry: Control with a gradient where small clouds should appear, based on type 0.0

section.name: Rain amount 1:
section.entry: Adjust the rain amount from the weather map

section.name: Load Sky
section.entry: Load a skybox texture... It can be either a cubemap or spherical projection map

section.name: Coverage minimum 2:
section.entry: Adjust the minimum amount from the weather map

section.name: widget_33
section.entry: Control the inward amount for medium clouds (type 0.5). Specify amount top (X), top offset (Y), amount bot (Z), bot offset (W)

section.name: Rain minimum 1:
section.entry: Adjust the minimum rain from the weather map

section.name: KTX2 Convert
section.entry: All material textures in the scene will be converted to KTX2 format. THIS MIGHT TAKE LONG, SO GET YOURSELF A COFFEE OR TEA!

section.name: Total noise scale 1:
section.entry: Total scale adjusts base noise, detail noise and curl noise

section.name: widget_25
section.entry: Control with a gradient where large clouds should appear, based on type 1.0

section.name: widget_16
section.entry: Control with a gradient where small clouds should appear, based on type 0.0

section.name: Gravity:
section.entry: Set the gravity factor on Y (vertical) axis for physics.

section.name: widget_19
section.entry: Control with a gradient where small clouds should appear, based on type 0.0

section.name: widget_32
section.entry: Control the inward amount for medium clouds (type 0.5). Specify amount top (X), top offset (Y), amount bot (Z), bot offset (W)

section.name: widget_26
section.entry: Control with a gradient where large clouds should appear, based on type 1.0

section.name: Wind up amount 1:
section.entry: How much wind up drag the noise recieves

section.name: High Quality Sky:
section.entry: Skip LUT for more accurate sky and aerial perspective. This also enables shadowmaps to affect sky calculations. Note: For volumetric shadows to be visible, increase shadowmap boundary and/or enable cloud shadows.

section.name: Skew coverage 1:
section.entry: This pulls the entire clouds towards the wind direction along height

section.name: widget_18
section.entry: Control with a gradient where small clouds should appear, based on type 0.0

section.name: Coverage amount 1:
section.entry: Adjust the coverage amount from the weather map

section.name: WeatherPreset - White Furnace
section.entry: The white furnace mode sets the environment to fully white, it is useful to test energy conservation of light and materials. If you don't see it as fully white, it is because the tone mapping.

section.name: widget_31
section.entry: Control the inward amount for small clouds (type 0.0). Specify amount top (X), top offset (Y), amount bot (Z), bot offset (W)

section.name: Detail height 1:
section.entry: Higher values pulls the detail more towards bottom

section.name: widget_27
section.entry: Control with a gradient where large clouds should appear, based on type 1.0

section.name: Coverage amount 2:
section.entry: Adjust the coverage amount from the weather map

section.name: Load Volumetric Clouds Weather Map 2
section.entry: Load a weather map for volumetric clouds. Red channel is coverage, green is type and blue is water density (rain).

section.name: Set as primary weather
section.entry: This will be set as the primary weather used in rendering

section.name: Cloud thickness:
section.entry: Specify the cloud system thickness, so from the start height plus additional thickness on top

section.name: WeatherPreset - Daytime
section.entry: Apply this weather preset to the world.

section.name: EliminateCoarseCascades
section.entry: Eliminate the coarse cascade mask for every object in the scene.

section.name: Once:
section.entry: Play the script only one time, and stop immediately. Useful for having custom update frequency logic in the script.

section.name: X
section.entry: Remove currently selected subset. LODs will be lost and need to be regenerated!

section.name: Sloppy LOD:
section.entry: Use the sloppy simplification algorithm, which is faster but doesn't preserve shape well.

section.name: Weight:
section.entry: Set the weight for morph target

section.name: Material:
section.entry: Set the base material of the selected MeshSubset

section.name: Select subset:
section.entry: Select a subset. A subset can also be selected by picking it in the 3D scene. Look at the material window when a subset is selected to edit it. If you add a new subset, LODs will be lost and need to be regenerated!

section.name: Compute Normals [HARD]
section.entry: Compute surface normals of the mesh. Resulting normals will be unique per face. This can increase vertex count.

section.name: Double Sided:
section.entry: If enabled, the inside of the mesh will be visible.

section.name: Impostor Dist:
section.entry: Assign the distance where the mesh geometry should be switched to the impostor image.

section.name: Tess Factor:
section.entry: Set the dynamic tessellation amount. Tessellation should be enabled in the Renderer window and your GPU must support it!

section.name: Flip Culling
section.entry: Flip faces to reverse triangle culling order.

section.name: Compute Normals [SMOOTH]
section.entry: Compute surface normals of the mesh. Resulting normals will be unique per vertex. This can reduce vertex count, but is slow.

section.name: Double Sided Shadow:
section.entry: If enabled, the shadow rendering will be forced to use double sided mode. This can help fix some shadow artifacts without enabling double sided mode for the main rendering of this mesh.

section.name: Morph Target:
section.entry: Choose a morph target to edit weight.

section.name: LOD Error:
section.entry: Lower values will make more precise levels of detail.

section.name: LOD Count:
section.entry: This is how many levels of detail will be created.

section.name: LOD Quality:
section.entry: Lower values will make LODs more agressively simplified.

section.name: Create Impostor
section.entry: Create an impostor image of the mesh. The mesh will be replaced by this image when far away, to render faster.

section.name: 2D:
section.entry: Sounds in the scene are 3D spatial by default. Select this to disable 3D effect.

section.name: Reverb:
section.entry: Set the global reverb setting. Sound instances need to enable reverb to take effect!

section.name: Looped:
section.entry: Enable looping for the selected sound instance.

section.name: Volume:
section.entry: Set volume level for the selected sound instance.

section.name: Open File 
section.entry: Open sound file. Supported extensions: WAV, OGG

section.name: Submix:
section.entry: Set the submix channel of the sound. Sound properties like volume can be set per sound, or per submix channel.

section.name: End
section.entry: Set the animation end in seconds. This is relative to 0, not the animation start.

section.name: Start
section.entry: Set the animation start in seconds. This will be the loop's starting point.

section.name: widget_44
section.entry: The animation window will stay open even if you select other entities until it is collapsed, so you can record other entities' data.

section.name: Record:
section.entry: Record selected entities' specified channels into the animation at the current time.

section.name: Sampling:
section.entry: Choose how animation data is interpreted between keyframes. Note that Cubic spline sampling requires spline animation data, otherwise, it will fall back to Linear! Currently spline animation data creation is not supported, but it can be imported from GLTF/VRM models.

section.name: Retarget:
section.entry: Make a copy of this animation and retarget it for a humanoid. This will only work for bones in this animation that are part of a humanoid.

section.name: Amount:
section.entry: Set the animation blending amount by hand.

section.name: Timer:
section.entry: Set the animation timer by hand.

section.name: Mass:
section.entry: Set the mass amount for the physics engine.

section.name: Friction:
section.entry: Set the friction amount for the physics engine.

section.name: Restitution:
section.entry: Set the restitution amount for the physics engine.

section.name: widget_111
section.entry: Soft body physics must be used together with a MeshComponent, otherwise it will have no effect. You can use the Paint Tool to pin or soften soft body vertices.

section.name: Blend mode:
section.entry: Set the blend mode of the material.

section.name: Clearcoat Roughness:
section.entry: This affects roughness of clear coat layer.

section.name: Reflectance:
section.entry: Adjust the surface [non-metal] reflectivity (also called specularFactor). Note: this is not available in specular-glossiness workflow

section.name: Subsurface Scattering:
section.entry: Subsurface scattering amount. You can also adjust the subsurface color by selecting it in the color picker

section.name: Texcoord anim V:
section.entry: Adjust the texture animation speed along the V direction in texture space.

section.name: Occlusion 1:
section.entry: If enabled, surface map's RED channel will be used as occlusion map

section.name: Texcoord anim U:
section.entry: Adjust the texture animation speed along the U direction in texture space.

section.name: Cast Shadow:
section.entry: The subset will contribute to the scene shadows if enabled.

section.name: Cartoon Outline:
section.entry: Enable cartoon outline. The Cartoon Outline graphics setting also needs to be enabled for it to show up.

section.name: Roughness:
section.entry: Adjust the surface roughness. Rough surfaces are less shiny, more matte.

section.name: Double sided:
section.entry: Decide whether to render both sides of the material (It's also possible to set this behaviour per mesh).

section.name: Use vertex colors:
section.entry: Enable if you want to render the mesh with vertex colors (must have appropriate vertex buffer)

section.name: AlphaRef:
section.entry: Adjust the alpha cutoff threshold. Alpha cutout can affect performance

section.name: Normalmap:
section.entry: How much the normal map should distort the face normals (bumpiness).

section.name: Emissive:
section.entry: Adjust the light emission of the surface. The color of the light emitted is that of the color of the material.

section.name: MaterialName
section.entry: Set a name for the material...

section.name: Displacement:
section.entry: Adjust how much the bump map should modulate the geometry when using tessellation.

section.name: Color picker mode:
section.entry: Choose the destination data of the color picker.

section.name: Texcoord anim FPS:
section.entry: Adjust the texture animation frame rate (frames per second). Any value above 0 will make the material dynamic.

section.name: Shading Rate:
section.entry: Select shading rate for this material. Selecting larger shading rate will decrease rendering quality of this material, but increases performance. Requires hardware support for variable shading rate

section.name: Sheen Roughness:
section.entry: This affects roughness of sheen layer for cloth shading.

section.name: Transmission:
section.entry: Adjust the transmissiveness. More transmissiveness means more diffuse light is transmitted instead of absorbed.

section.name: Refraction:
section.entry: Adjust the refraction amount for transmissive materials.

section.name: Spec-gloss workflow:
section.entry: If enabled, surface map will be viewed like it contains specular color (RGB) and smoothness (A)

section.name: Occlusion 2:
section.entry: If enabled, occlusion map's RED channel will be used as occlusion map

section.name: Wind:
section.entry: If enabled, vertex wind weights will affect how much wind offset affects the subset.

section.name: Metalness:
section.entry: The more metal-like the surface is, the more the its color will contribute to the reflection color. Note: this is not available in specular-glossiness workflow

section.name: Texture Slot:
section.entry: Choose the texture slot to modify.

section.name: Shader:
section.entry: Select a shader for this material. Custom shaders (*) will also show up here (see wi::renderer:RegisterCustomShader() for more info.) Note that custom shaders (*) can't select between blend modes, as they are created with an explicit blend mode.

section.name: Gravity:
section.entry: Set the amount of gravity. Positive values attract, negatives deflect.

section.name:  Inverse Kinematics
section.entry:  インバースキネマティクス

section.name: Target:
section.entry: Choose a target entity (with transform) that the IK will follow

section.name: Chain Length:
section.entry: How far the hierarchy chain is simulated backwards from this entity

section.name: Iteration Count:
section.entry: How many iterations to compute the inverse kinematics for. Higher values are slower but more accurate.

section.name: widget_69
section.entry: Yaw (in degrees) Note: Euler angle rotations can result in precision loss from quaternion conversion!

section.name: widget_68
section.entry: Pitch (in degrees) Note: Euler angle rotations can result in precision loss from quaternion conversion!

section.name: widget_67
section.entry: Roll (in degrees) Note: Euler angle rotations can result in precision loss from quaternion conversion!

section.name: CPU:
section.entry: Enable for use on the CPU. CPU usage includes: springs.

section.name: GPU:
section.entry: Enable for use on the GPU. GPU usage includes: emitter and hair particle systems. Note that GPU can support only a limited amount of colliders.

section.name: widget_112
section.entry: Colliders are used for simple fake physics, without using the physics engine. They are only used in specific CPU/GPU systems.

section.name: Static:
section.entry: Static lights will only be used for baking into lightmaps.

section.name: LensFlareSlot
section.entry: Load a lensflare texture to this slot

section.name: Volumetric Clouds:
section.entry: When enabled light emission will affect volumetric clouds.

section.name: Shadow resolution:
section.entry: You can force a fixed resolution for this light's shadow map to avoid dynamic scaling. If you leave it as dynamic, the resolution will be scaled between 0 and the max shadow resolution in the renderer for this light type, based on light's distance and size.

section.name: Length:
section.entry: [Experimental] Adjust the length of the light source. With this you can make capsule light out of a point light.

section.name: Radius:
section.entry: [Experimental] Adjust the radius of the light source. For directional light, this will only affect ray traced shadow softness.

section.name: Range:
section.entry: Adjust the maximum range the light can affect.

section.name: Inner Cone Angle:
section.entry: Adjust the inner cone aperture for spotlight. (The inner cone will always be inside the outer cone)

section.name: Shadow:
section.entry: Set light as shadow caster. Many shadow casters can affect performance!

section.name: Outer Cone Angle:
section.entry: Adjust the main cone aperture for spotlight.

section.name: Volumetric:
section.entry: Compute volumetric light scattering effect. The fog settings affect scattering (see Weather window). If there is no fog, there is no scattering.

section.name: Intensity:
section.entry: Brightness of light in. The units that this is defined in depend on the type of light. Point and spot lights use luminous intensity in candela (lm/sr) while directional lights use illuminance in lux (lm/m2).

section.name: Add:
section.entry: Add a component to the last selected entity.

section.name: widget_115
section.entry: This window will stay open even if you select other entities until it is collapsed, so you can select other bone entities.

section.name: Head horizontal:
section.entry: Limit horizontal head movement (input in degrees)

section.name: Eye horizontal:
section.entry: Limit horizontal eye movement (input in degrees)

section.name: LookAt:
section.entry: Enable updating the lookAt direction. If enabled, head will turn to face the lookAt point. A sample lookAt point can be generated by the editor if you enable the Follow mouse option.

section.name: Head vertical:
section.entry: Limit vertical head movement (input in degrees)

section.name: Follow mouse:
section.entry: Generates a sample lookAt point at the mouse position. If LookAt is enabled, the character's head will try to face in the direction of the mouse

section.name: Eye vertical:
section.entry: Limit vertical eye movement (input in degrees)

section.name: widget_113
section.entry: Tip: If you also attach a Sound component to this entity, the mouth expression (if available) will be animated based on the sound playing.

section.name: Blinks:
section.entry: Specifies the number of blinks per second.

section.name: Looks:
section.entry: Specifies the number of look-aways per second.

section.name: widget_114
section.entry: This window will stay open even if you select other entities until it is collapsed, so you can select other bone entities.

section.name: Mass:
section.entry: Set the mass amount for the physics engine.

section.name: Linear Damping:
section.entry: Set the linear damping amount for the physics engine.

section.name: Use Mesh LOD:
section.entry: Specify which LOD to use for triangle mesh physics.

section.name: Friction:
section.entry: Set the friction amount for the physics engine.

section.name: Restitution:
section.entry: Set the restitution amount for the physics engine.

section.name: Angular Damping:
section.entry: Set the angular damping amount for the physics engine.

section.name:  Hair Particle System
section.entry:  ヘアパーティクルシステム

section.name: Mesh:
section.entry: Choose a mesh where hair will grow from...

section.name: widget_57
section.entry: How many horizontal frames there are in the spritesheet.

section.name: widget_59
section.entry: Enter a value to enable the random sprite sheet frame selection's max frame number.

section.name: Randomness:
section.entry: Set hair length randomization factor. This will affect randomness of hair lengths.

section.name: widget_58
section.entry: How many vertical frames there are in the spritesheet.

section.name: View distance:
section.entry: Set view distance. After this, particles will be faded out.

section.name: Random seed:
section.entry: Set hair system-wide random seed value. This will affect hair patch placement randomization.

section.name: Stiffness:
section.entry: Set hair strand stiffness, how much it tries to get back to rest position.

section.name: widget_60
section.entry: Specifies the first frame of the sheet that can be used.

section.name: LOD Multiplier:
section.entry: How much the distance to camera will affect LOD selection. (If the mesh has lods)

section.name: Lightmap resolution:
section.entry: Set the approximate resolution for this object's lightmap. This will be packed into the larger global lightmap later.

section.name: Clear Lightmap
section.entry: Clear the lightmap from this object.

section.name: Cast Shadow:
section.entry: Set object to be participating in shadows.

section.name: Renderable:
section.entry: Set object to be participating in rendering.

section.name: Transparency:
section.entry: Adjust transparency of the object. Opaque materials will use dithered transparency in this case!

section.name: Color picker mode:
section.entry: Choose the destination data of the color picker.

section.name: Stop Lightmap Gen
section.entry: Stop the lightmap rendering and save the lightmap. If denoiser is enabled, this is the point at which lightmap will be denoised, which could take a while.

section.name: UV Set:
section.entry: Set which UV set to use when generating the lightmap Atlas

section.name: Navmesh:
section.entry: Set object to be a navigation mesh filtering (FILTER_NAVIGATION_MESH).

section.name: Cascade Mask:
section.entry: How many shadow cascades to skip when rendering this object into shadow maps? (0: skip none, it will be in all cascades, 1: skip first (biggest cascade), ...etc...

section.name: Generate Lightmap
section.entry: Render the lightmap for only this object. It will automatically combined with the global lightmap.

section.name: Draw Distance:
section.entry: Specify the draw distance of the object

section.name: Sort Priority:
section.entry: Set to larger value to draw earlier (most useful for transparents with alpha blending, if the sorting order by distance is not good enough)

section.name: Decal Placement Enabled:
section.entry: Enable decal placement. Use the left mouse button to place decals to the scene.

section.name: Slope Blend:
section.entry: Set a power factor for blending on surface slopes. 0 = no slope blend, increasing = more slope blend

section.name: widget_42
section.entry: Set decal properties in the Material component. Decals support the following material properties: - Base color - Base color texture - Emissive strength - Normalmap texture - Normalmap strength - Surfacemap texture - Texture tiling (TexMulAdd)

section.name: Alpha only basecolor:
section.entry: You can enable this to only use alpha channel from basecolor map. Useful for blending normalmap-only decals.

section.name: Parent:
section.entry: Choose a parent entity (also works if selected entity has no transform)

section.name: LayerWindowLabel
section.entry: The layer is a 32-bit mask (uint32_t), which can be used for filtering by multiple systems (visibility, collision, picking, etc.). - If all bits are disabled, it means the layer will be inactive in most systems. - For ray tracing, the lower 8 bits will be used as instance inclusion mask.

section.name: widget_41
section.entry: Environment probes can be used to capture the scene from a specific location in a 360 degrees panorama. The probes will be used for reflections fallback, where a better reflection type is not available. The probes can affect the ambient colors slightly. Tip: You can scale, rotate and move the probes to set up parallax correct rendering to affect a specific area only. The parallax correction will take effect inside the probe's bounds (indicated with a cyan colored box).

section.name: RealTime:
section.entry: Enable continuous rendering of the probe in every frame.

section.name: MSAA:
section.entry: Enable Multi Sampling Anti Aliasing for the probe, this will improve its quality.

section.name: Refresh All
section.entry: Re-renders all probes in the scene.

section.name: SPH (h):
section.entry: Set the SPH parameter: smoothing radius

section.name: Drag:
section.entry: The velocity will be multiplied with this value, so lower than 1 will slow decelerate the particles.

section.name: SPH - FluidSim:
section.entry: Enable particle collisions with each other. Simulate with Smooth Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) solver.

section.name: widget_46
section.entry: How many horizontal frames there are in the spritesheet.

section.name: SPH (K):
section.entry: Set the SPH parameter: pressure constant

section.name: Mesh:
section.entry: Choose an mesh that particles will be emitted from...

section.name: Sorting:
section.entry: Enable sorting of the particles. This might slow down performance.

section.name: widget_47
section.entry: How many vertical frames there are in the spritesheet.

section.name: SPH (p0):
section.entry: Set the SPH parameter: reference density

section.name: Frame Blending:
section.entry: If sprite sheet animation is in effect, frames will be smoothly blended.

section.name: Scaling:
section.entry: Set the scaling of the particles based on their lifetime.

section.name: Size:
section.entry: Set the size of the emitted particles.

section.name: Timestep:
section.entry: Adjust timestep for emitter simulation. -1 means variable timestep, positive means fixed timestep.

section.name: Motion blur:
section.entry: Set the motion blur amount for the particle system.

section.name: widget_45
section.entry: Enter a value to enable looping sprite sheet animation (frames per second). Set 0 for animation along paritcle lifetime.

section.name: Normal factor:
section.entry: Set the velocity of the emitted particles based on the normal vector of the emitter surface.

section.name: Restitution:
section.entry: If the particles have collision enabled, then after collision this is a multiplier for their bouncing velocities

section.name: Depth Buffer:
section.entry: Enable particle collisions with the depth buffer.

section.name: Randomness:
section.entry: Set the general randomness of the emitter.

section.name: Emit:
section.entry: Set the number of particles to emit per second.

section.name: SPH (e):
section.entry: Set the SPH parameter: viscosity constant

section.name: Color randomness:
section.entry: Set the randomness of color for the emitted particles.

section.name: Max count:
section.entry: Set the maximum amount of particles this system can handle. This has an effect on the memory budget.

section.name: Volume:
section.entry: Enable volume for the emitter. Particles will be emitted inside volume.

section.name: Life span:
section.entry: Set the lifespan of the emitted particles (in seconds).

section.name: Rotation:
section.entry: Set the rotation velocity of the emitted particles.

section.name: widget_48
section.entry: Enter a value to enable the random sprite sheet frame selection's max frame number.

section.name: Colliders disabled:
section.entry: Simply disables all colliders for acting on this particle system

section.name: ShaderType:
section.entry: Choose a shader type for the particles. This is responsible of how they will be rendered.

section.name: Life randomness:
section.entry: Set the randomness of lifespans for the emitted particles.

section.name: widget_49
section.entry: Specifies the starting frame of the animation.

section.name: Drag:
section.entry: The drag affects how fast energy is lost (higher values make the spring come to rest faster)

section.name: Reset All
section.entry: Reset all springs in the scene to initial pose.

section.name: DEBUG:
section.entry: Enabling this will visualize springs as small yellow X-es in the scene

section.name: Wind affection:
section.entry: How much the global wind effect affects the spring

section.name: Stretch enabled:
section.entry: Stretch means that length from parent transform won't be preserved.

section.name: Gravity enabled:
section.entry: Whether global gravity should affect the spring

section.name: Stiffness:
section.entry: The stiffness affects how strongly the spring tries to orient itself to rest pose (higher values increase the jiggliness)

section.name: Far Plane:
section.entry: Controls the camera's far clip plane, geometry farther than this will be clipped.

section.name: Aperture Shape Y:
section.entry: Controls the depth of field effect's bokeh shape

section.name: Aperture Size:
section.entry: Controls the depth of field effect's strength

section.name: Aperture Shape X:
section.entry: Controls the depth of field effect's bokeh shape

section.name: Focal Length:
section.entry: Controls the depth of field effect's focus distance

section.name: FOV:
section.entry: Controls the camera's top-down field of view (in degrees)

section.name: Near Plane:
section.entry: Controls the camera's near clip plane, geometry closer than this will be clipped.

section.name: Add Modifier:
section.entry: Add a new modifier that will affect terrain generation.

section.name: Prop Distance:
section.entry: How far out props will be generated (value is in number of chunks)

section.name: Mesh LOD Distance:
section.entry: Set the LOD (Level Of Detail) distance multiplier. Low values increase LOD detail in distance

section.name: Physics Distance:
section.entry: How far out physics meshes will be generated (value is in number of chunks)

section.name: Generation Distance:
section.entry: How far out chunks will be generated (value is in number of chunks)

section.name: Tessellation:
section.entry: Specify whether tessellation is enabled for terrain surface. Tessellation requires GPU hardware support Tessellation doesn't work with raytracing effects or Visibility Compute Shading rendering mode.

section.name: Removal:
section.entry: Automatically remove chunks that are farther than generation distance around center chunk.

section.name: Grass:
section.entry: Specify whether grass generation is enabled.

section.name: Chunk Scale:
section.entry: Size of one chunk in horizontal directions. Larger chunk scale will cover larger distance, but will have less detail per unit.

section.name: Save Heightmap...
section.entry: Save a heightmap texture from the currently generated terrain, where the red channel corresponds to terrain height and the resolution to dimensions. The heightmap will be normalized into 8bit PNG format which can result in precision loss!

section.name: Center to Cam:
section.entry: Automatically generate chunks around camera. This sets the center chunk to camera position.

section.name: Physics:
section.entry: Specify whether physics is enabled for newly generated terrain chunks.

section.name: Full screen
section.entry: 全画面表示の切り替え
最後に使用した(スタンドアロン)スクリプトを実行する. 新しいスクリプトを使用するには、[開く] ボタン.

section.name: Bug report
section.entry: バグや問題を報告できるブラウザウィンドウが開きます. URL: https://github.com/turanszkij/WickedEngine/issues/new

section.name: Open
section.entry: シーンを開いたり、モデルをインポートしたり、Luaスクリプトを実行したり...

section.name: Profiler
section.entry: プロファイラーフレームのタイミングを表示する
